I have finished the game twice the second time being only a few days ago. Ultimately, I do think that Half-Life 2 is a little overrated. It is a lot of fun and the story, character, and atmosphere are absolutely great, but the gunplay itself is not nearly as satisfying as a lot of other games. It's heavy focus on physics puzzles highlighting the Source engine's abilities also stick out as a dated mechanic. It's great to go back and have a look at what was for its time one of the most innovative games and it is still an enjoyable game to play, but I don't think it is quite as utterly amazing as most of us perhaps think it was. Also, buyer beware, Half-Life 2: Ep. 2 does have something of a cliffhanger ending that has been left hanging since 2007 and in my personal opinion is very unlikely to ever be resolved by any official Valve release. 

However, Project Borealis, which is based on Mark Laidlaw's Epistle 3, may offer some measure of closure to long time Half-Life fans once it does release. 

Also, only go for the neighborhood watch achievement on hard difficulty  if you're a compulsive masochist like myself. Otherwise, spare yourself the pain.
